documenttitle.text: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: GTK+ bug fix update

note.text: An update for GTK+ is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The GTK+ packages contain the GIMP ToolKit (GTK+), a library for creating graphical user interfaces for the X Window System. 

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.4 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Users of GTK+ are advised to upgrade to these updated packages.
note.title: Details

note.text: This content is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). If you distribute this content, or a modified version of it, you must provide attribution to Red Hat Inc. and provide a link to the original.
note.title: Terms of Use

documentdistribution.text: Copyright Â© 2023 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

note.text: Heap-based buffer overflow in the gdk_pixbuf_flip function in gdk-pixbuf-scale.c in gdk-pixbuf 2.30.x allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted BMP file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1378894: CVE-2015-7552 gdk-pixbuf: Heap-based buffer overflow in the gdk_pixbuf_flip function

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Gustavo Grieco for reporting this issue.
